ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Speaking, writing, reading and understanding basic conversations and grammar even with no prior knowledge of the langauge.
I learned how to read and write hangul, basic vocabulary, expressions, and grammar in Korean, and aspects of Korean culture.
Basic Korean: introductions, directions, talking about likes/wants, talking about what youre doing, etc. By the end of the course, we were able to make a ~10 minute skit in Korean!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strenghts:
everyday format make sure that you are able to learn the language quickly

Weaknesses:
The textbook used does not accommodate for self study - would prefer some aid in resources to help self-study.

strengths: Professor Back is such a kind and approachable teacher who creates a relaxed atmosphere in the classroom. Professor Back also gives out a lot of dictation quizzes, which I heard other teachers don't do. At first, they may feel tedious, but they proved to be extremely helpful for someone like me who was starting out in Korean. By taking these quizzes, I was forced to memorize how to spell and write out words in hangul accurately.
weaknesses: the quality of the textbook materials and curriculum is not that high, and features outdated character personalities such as Andy, who is this annoying and creepy guy. Additionally, it's not a weakness per se but Professor Back always ends class 3-5 minutes after the scheduled end time, which made it stressful for me to get to my next class that starts right after Korean class.

Strengths: This class was really well organized and very fun. I truly looked forward to coming to this class every morning despite it being on the other end of campus. I also felt like I was learning a lot.

Weaknesses: This is quite minor but the daily nearly dictation quizzes got a bit cumbersome at times.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Recommend because the everyday format really helped you learn a language
Yes if you want to learn Korean! I would also recommend taking it specifically with professor Back.
Absolutely! I learned so much, it was very fun, the workload was very reasonable, and I made many friends.
